questions.question: In which ancient Roman city, destroyed by a volcanic eruption in 79 AD, can you explore ruins frozen in time including intact frescoes and mosaics, in Italy?
questions.context: Located near modern-day Naples, this city offers a glimpse into daily life during the Roman Empire, preserved by volcanic ash.

questions.question: Which famous museum located in France houses the Mona Lisa and was originally built as a fortress in the late 12th century?
questions.context: This historic building was transformed into a museum in 1793 and is the world's largest art museum by size.

questions.question: What is the name of the capital city that holds the Great Sphinx and the Pyramids of Giza, important symbols of ancient Egyptian history?
questions.context: This bustling city on the Nile River is known for its proximity to ancient wonders and serves as Egypt's political and cultural center.

questions.question: In which man-made marvel located in the UAE can you find the world's tallest building, completed in 2010?
questions.context: Standing at over 828 meters, this iconic skyscraper offers breathtaking views of Dubai from its observation decks.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in China is famous for its Terracotta Army, constructed during the reign of the first Emperor of China in the 3rd century BC?
questions.context: Discovered in 1974, this site features thousands of life-sized terracotta figures buried to protect Emperor Qin Shi Huang in the afterlife.
